og.title: Pam Walker retires as Health Director, Melba Moore appointed Acting Health Director

article_summary:
Moore, a Certified Public Health Administrator, has served as the City's Health Commissioner for 14 years and worked hand-in-hand with Walker.
"Melba Moore will build on Pam's work to continue to address other health challenges such as health disparities and obesity."
According to the City of St. Louis, during her tenure – working alongside Health Commissioner Melba Moore – the leading indicators of health have improved across the board.
Together we have made great improvements in public health in the City, improved our residents’ quality of life and saved lives," Walker said.
After eight years of serving as Mayor Francis Slay's Health Director, Pam Walker is stepping down.
